BAND INFO

QUOTE
"An impressive piece of Gothic Rock" (Heavy 11/12 pt.) is what beyond the void provided on their debut "our somewhere else? (Omniamedia / Rough Trade). In that vein 9.3 millionen magazines celebrated the border runners, whose high percentage mix of Gothic, Rock & Metal scored in all three worlds, thanks to quality fetish and fresh ideas.

Next strike happened in spring 2006 when CD #2 appeared on Fear Section (Label of Chris Pohl, Blutengel): "i am your ruin", a lovely bastard of blow away Rock and gripping Gothic, a mean mixture you don&#039;t want to meet in the dark, but with which you&#039;re gonna end up in bed anyway! For this album, the band&#039;s 4 songwriters wrote 25 songs, of which only 12 finalists made it through a tough internal quality assurance. This "best of" is launched at "exceptional vocalist and top musicians" (Break Out), resulting in one big load of vengeful feelings, captivatingly served. As "i am your ruin" is about the uprising of the destroyed - a sort of retribution to the dreamy melancholic debut.
